description: Known ambiguous phrases in requirements with suggested clarifications

ambiguity_patterns.clarification: Define the specific conditions that trigger this action. What criteria determine when it is needed?
Define measurable criteria for what constitutes 'appropriate' in this context.
Specify an exact time threshold (e.g., within 2 seconds, within 24 hours).
Define specific usability criteria: max clicks to complete task, WCAG compliance level, user satisfaction score target.
Specify a measurable target (e.g., <2 second response time, <500ms API latency).
Specify security requirements: FIPS 140-2 encryption, CAC authentication, STIG compliance, specific NIST controls.
Define target scale: max concurrent users, data volume growth rate, horizontal vs vertical scaling requirements.
Define efficiency metric: CPU utilization target, memory footprint limit, cost per transaction.
Define the quantitative threshold that constitutes 'reasonable' in this context.
Define the minimum acceptable criteria with measurable thresholds.
Define what specifically needs to be configurable and what the expected variation parameters are.
Define failure scenarios the system must handle and recovery time objectives.
Enumerate all items explicitly. Incomplete lists lead to scope creep and missing requirements.
Clarify whether this is inclusive OR (either or both) or exclusive OR (one but not both).
Is this a MUST (mandatory) or SHOULD (recommended)? Use RFC 2119 language for clarity.
